turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: We're gonna go to the next town and stop.  We'll get a motel room.  I can rest for a while and then figure out how to get some money.  We're gonna need money.  Thelma.  How much money do you have with you?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: What?  Oh, I don't know.  Let me look.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: I'm cash poor.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Hmmm.  We gotta get some money.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Oh, I don't know.  I'm just nervous. I gotta figure out what to do.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Well, when you figure it out, wake me up.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Just what the hell is wrong with you?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Why are you actin' like this?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Actin' like what?!  How am I supposed to act?  'Scuse me for not knowing what to do after you blow somebody's head off!

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: You could help me try and figure it out!  I gotta figure out what to do, and you could try and help me.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: I suggested we go to the police, but you didn't like that; so, frankly, Louise, I'm all out of ideas.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Well, what's the big rush, Thelma? If we just give 'em some time, they'll come to us...!  Oh Christ. I'm just not ready to go to jail yet.  Why don't you go out to the pool or something and I'll figure it out...

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Give me the keys.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: You're not touchin' that car.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: My stuff's in the trunk!  God!  You care more about that car than you do about most people.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Most people just cause me trouble, but that car always gets me out of it.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Did you finish thinking?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: I think better when I drive.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Don't get mad, Louise, but where are we going?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Oklahoma City.  Jimmy's gonna wire me some money, and then...

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: You talked to him?!  Is he mad?  Did you tell him?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: No, I didn't tell him.  And that's something we gotta get straight. Darryl's been callin', mad as a hornet, makin' all kinds of noise. When you talk to him, you cannot say anything about this.  You gotta make sure everything sounds normal.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: I called the asshole at 4:00 in the morning and he wasn't even home.  I don't know what he's got to be mad about.  I'm the one who should be mad.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: I've been tellin' you that for the last ten years.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Do you think Darryl's having an affair?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: I don't think Darryl is mature enough to conduct an affair.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: But you think he fools around.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Thelma, I'm going to Mexico.  I think I can make it in two and a half days, but I'm going to have to haul ass.  Are you up to this?  I mean, I have to know.  This isn't a game.  I'm in deep shit.  I gotta know what you're gonna do.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: I... I don't know.  I don't know what you're askin' me.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Don't you fall apart on me. Goddamnit, Thelma.  Every time we get in trouble, you go blank or plead insanity or some such shit, and this time... Not this time. Everything's changed now... Now you can do whatever you want, but I'm going to Mexico.  I'm going.  Are you coming with me?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Call him?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Call him.  Don't tell him anything. Tell him you're having a wonderful time and you'll be home tomorrow night.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Will I be?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: I don't know.  I won't be.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Louise, this young man is on his way back to school and needs a ride, and I thought since...

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: It's probably not a good idea.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Louise.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: I wish we could've brought him with us.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: What did Darryl say?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: He said "Okay, Thelma.  I just wanted to know you were alright.  I hope you're havin' a good time.  You sure deserve one after puttin' up with me all the time.  I love you, honey."

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: I just don't see what it would hurt just to give somebody a ride.  Did you see his butt?  Darryl doesn't have a cute butt.  You could park a car in the shadow of his ass.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: I'm sorry.  I'm just not in the mood for company right now.  Here.  Take this map.  I need you to find all the secondary roads to Mexico from Oklahoma City.  I think we should stay off the interstates.  We're too conspicuous.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Well, it looks like we can get on this road 81 that heads down towards Dallas, then cut over to...

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: I don't want to go that way.  Find a way that we don't have to go through Texas.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Wait.  What?  You want to go to Mexico from Oklahoma and you don't want to go through Texas?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: You know how I feel about Texas... We're not going that way.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: I know, Louise, but we're running for our lives!  Don't you think you could make an exception just this once?!  I mean, look at the map. The only thing between Oklahoma and Mexico is Texas!

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Thelma!  I'm not gonna talk about this!  Now find another way or give me the goddamn map and I will!  You understand?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: No, Louise.  How come you never said what happened?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: He's got a lot to be proud of.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Louise and Darryl don't get along.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: That's puttin' it mildly.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: She thinks he's a pig.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: He's a real piece o' work.  I wish you could meet him.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Yup.  That's him goin'.  I love to watch him go.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Thelma kinda took to him.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: I don't care what you say about him. The boy has got it bad.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: He's always got it bad as long as I'm running in the other direction. Don't be fooled, he's no different than any other guy.  He knows how to chase and that's it.  Once he's caught you, he don't know what to do.  So he runs away.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: I heard that.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: So what are you gonna tell him?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Nothing.  I'm not gonna tell him a thing.  The least I can do is not make him an accessory any more than he already is.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: You are so sweet to that guy, you really are.  Imagine not wanting to drag him into this.  He is a lucky man.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: I didn't ask him to come!  It's like I said, Thelma, he just loves the chase.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Well boy, he's got his work cut out for him now, don't he?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Put a lid on it, Thelma!  It's hard enough as it is.  Just let me get this part over with.  Now stay here and guard the money.  If there's any problem I'm in room 115.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: I won't wait up.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: How do I look?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: You're a vision, Louise, a goddamn vision of loveliness, you always are.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Have another drink, Thelma.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: What happened to your hair?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Nothing.  It got messed up.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: What's wrong with you?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Nothing.  Why?  Do I seem different?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Yes, now that you mention it.  You seem crazy.  Like you're on drugs.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Well, I'm not on drugs.  But I might be crazy.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: I don't think I wanna hear what you're gonna tell me.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Oh, Thelma.  Oh, no.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: I mean I finally understand what all the fuss is about.   This is just a whole 'nother ball game!

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Thelma, please get a hold of yourself.  You're making a spectacle.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: You know, Louise, you're supposed to be my best friend.  You could at least be a little bit happy for me. You could at least pretend to be slightly happy that for once in my life I have a sexual experience that isn't completely disgusting.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: I'm sorry.  I am happy.  I'm very happy for you.  I'm glad you had a good time.  It's about time.  Where is he now?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Taking a shower.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: You left that guy alone in the room?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Eighty-eight dollars ain't gonna make a dent, baby girl.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Don't worry about it.  You want anything?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Drive!  Drive away!

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: I'm sorry.  Well, we need the money. Now we have it.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Oh shit, Thelma!!  Shit!  Shit! Shit!

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Now you get a grip, Louise!  Just drive us to Goddamn Mexico, will ya!

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Okay.  Shit, Thelma!  What'd you do? I mean, what did you say?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Well, I just...

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Holy shit.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Lemme see the map.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: For the first time in my life, I wish this car wasn't green.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Are you sure we should be driving like this?  In broad daylight and everything?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: No we shouldn't, but I want to put some distance between us and the scene of our last Goddamn crime!

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Oooooweee!!  You shoulda seen me! Like I'd been doin' it all my life! Nobody would ever believe it.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: You think you've found your calling?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Maybe.  Maybe.  The call of the wild!

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: You're disturbed.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Yes!  I believe I am!

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: So what's the plan, Thelma?  You just gonna stay drunk?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Try to.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Litterbug.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Ugh!!  Why do they have to do that?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: They think we like it.  Maybe they think it turns us on.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Thelma.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: I want you to call Darryl.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: What for?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: To find out if he knows anything. If you think he does, you gotta hang up because it means the police have told him and the phone is probably tapped.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Jeez, Louise, tapped the phone?  You think so?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Oh, come on!  Murder one and armed robbery, Thelma!

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Murder one!  God, Louise, can't we even say it was self-defense?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: But it wasn't!  We got away!  We were walkin' away!

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: They don't know that!  It was just you and me there.  I'll say he raped me and you had to shoot him!  I mean, it's almost the truth!

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: It won't work.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Why not?!

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: No physical evidence.  We can't prove he did it.  We probably can't even prove he touched you by now.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Besides, what do we say about the robbery?  No excuse for that.  No such thing as justifiable robbery.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Alright, Louise!

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Fill her up.  There's a phone right over there.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Let's get it over with.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: That J.D. kid is a little shit.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: What.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: How'd they find out we're going to Mexico, Thelma, how they know that?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: You told that thievin' little shit where we were goin'?!

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: I just told him if he ever gets to Mexico to look us up.  I asked him not to tell.  I didn't think he would tell anybody.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Why not?!  What's he got to lose? Other than my life's savings, that is.  Shit!

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Just stop talkin' to people, Thelma! Stop bein' so open!  We're fugitives now.  Let's behave that way!

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: You're right.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Louise?  Where are we?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Just past Boise City.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Idaho?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Oklahoma, Thelma.  We're crossing into New Mexico.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: I always wanted to see New Mexico.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Now what?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Now what what?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Whaddo we do?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Oh, I don't know, Thelma.  I guess maybe we could turn ourselves in and spend our lives trading cigarettes for mascara so we can look nice when our families come to visit us on Saturdays.  Maybe we could have children with the prison guards.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: I'm not suggestin' that!  I'm not goin' back.  No matter what happens. So don't worry about me.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Can I ask you kind of a weird question?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Of all the things in the world that scare you, what's the worst thing that scares you the most?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: You mean now or before?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Before.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: I guess I always thought the worst thing that could happen would be to end up old and alone in some crummy apartment with one of those little dogs.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: What little dogs?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: You know those little dogs you see people with?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Like a Chihuahua?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Those, too, but you know those little hairy ones?  Those flat-faced little fuckers with those ugly goddamned teeth?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Oh yeah.  You mean Peek-a-poos.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Yeah.  Those.  That always put the fear of God in me.  What about you?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Well, to be honest, the idea of getting old with Darryl was kinda startin' to get to me.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: I can see that.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: I mean, look how different he looks just since high school.  It's bad enough I have to get old, but doin' it with Darryl around is only gonna make it worse.  I mean, I don't think he's gonna be very nice about it.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Well, now, maybe you won't have to.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Always lookin' on the bright side, aren't ya?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: This is so beautiful.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Gosh.  It sure is.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: I always wanted to travel.  I just never got the opportunity.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Well, you got it now.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Look!  Look who it is, Thelma.  I'll be darned.  What's he doin' way out here.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Just ignore him.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Oh, Christ.  I hate this guy.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: We should have just ignored him.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Nothing.  It's not funny.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: What?  What's not funny, Thelma!

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: What?!

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Harlan.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: What?!  What about him?!

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Just the look on his face when you...  ... it's not funny.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Now, Thelma, that is not...

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Boy, he wasn't expectin' that!

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Thelma!

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Suck my dick... Boom!!

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: I don't want to talk about it! Thelma, I'm not kidding!  Don't you even...

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: ... in Texas... didn't it?  That's what happened... Oh my God.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: I'm warning you, Thelma.  You better drop it right now!  I don't want to talk about it!

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Okay, Louise... It's okay.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: What do we do?  What do you want to do?!

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: I don't know!  Shit!  Let's just play it by ear.  He may not know. He may just give me a ticket.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Please, God, please don't let us get caught.  Please, please, please...

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: I told you to slow down.  Hell, Officer, I told her to slow down.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: About how fast was I going?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: I am really sorry about this.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: I swear, before yesterday, neither one of us would have ever pulled a stunt like this.  But if you ever met my husband, you'd know why I just can... You wanna step out of the car, please?  You wanna put your hands on your head, please?  Louise, shoot the radio.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Shoot the radio!

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Sorry!

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Sorry!

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Ready?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Hit it.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: I know it's crazy, Louise, but I just feel like I've got a knack for this shit.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: I believe you.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Louise... are we still going to Mexico?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Well, I figure if you take a state policeman, shoot up his car, take his gun and lock him in the trunk, it's best to just get on out of the state if you can.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Just asking.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: I don't want to see any more beef jerky.  I mean the next beef jerky you hand me is going out the window. It's drivin' me crazy.  The whole car smells like it.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: It's good.  It's what the pioneers ate.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: I don't care what the damn pioneers ate.  You just keep that shit away from me, now I mean it.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: And I don't want any more Wild Turkey, either.  It's burning a hole in my stomach.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Okay, okay... I've got some tequila. You want some tequila?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: You do?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Yeah, you want it?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Shit.  I'm gettin' tired.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Are you alright?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: I think I've really fucked up.  I think I've got us in a situation where we could both get killed.  Why didn't we just go straight to the police.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: You know why.  You already said.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: What'd I say again?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Nobody would believe us.  We'd still get in trouble.  We'd still have our lives ruined.  And you know what else?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: That guy was hurtin' me.  And if you hadn't come out when you did, he'd a hurt me a lot worse.  And probably nothin' woulda happened to him. 'Cause everybody did see me dancin' with him all night.  And they woulda made out like I asked for it.  And my life woulda been ruined a whole lot worse than it is now.  At least now I'm havin' fun.  And I'm not sorry the son of a bitch is dead. I'm only sorry that it was you that did it and not me.  And if I haven't, I wanna take this time to thank you, Louise.  Thank you for savin' my ass.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: I said all that?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: No, Louise, you said the first part. I said all the rest.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Whatever.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Louise?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Yes, Thelma?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: You're not gonna give up on me, are ya?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: You're not gonna make some deal with that guy, are you?  I mean, I just wanna know.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: No, Thelma.  I'm not gonna make any deals.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: I can understand if you're thinkin' about it.  I mean, in a way, you've got something to go back for.  I mean Jimmy and everything.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Thelma, that is not an option.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: But I don't know... something's crossed over in me and I can't go back.  I mean, I just couldn't live...

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: I know.  I know what you mean.  I don't wanna end up on the damn Geraldo Show.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: He said they're charging us with murder.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Eeuww.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: And we have to decide whether we want to come out of this dead or alive.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Gosh, didn't he say anything positive at all?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Louise, do you think we should change cars, get another car?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Sure... You know how to hotwire a car?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Well, let me know when you figure it out.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: You awake?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: You could call it that.  My eyes are open.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Me too.  I feel awake.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Good.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Wide awake.  I don't remember ever feelin' this awake.  Everything looks different.  You know what I mean.  I know you know what I mean. Everything looks new.  Do you feel like that?  Like you've got something to look forward to?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: We'll be drinkin' margaritas by the sea, Mamasita.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: We can change our names.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: We can live in a hacienda.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: I wanna get a job.  I wanna work at Club Med.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Yes!  Yes!  Now what kind of deal do you think that cop can come up with to beat that?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: It'd have to be pretty good.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: It would have to be pretty damn good.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: We should head a little further in. There's not that many roads in this state.  I want to try to hit Mexico somewhere not so close to New Mexico.  They probably wanna kill us in New Mexico.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: You're drivin'.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Oh my God!  Louise!  Look!  Look! See if that's him!

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: It's him.  He's got California plates.  It's the same guy.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Pass him!

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: I mean really!  That business with your tongue.  What is that?  That's disgusting!

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: And, oh my God, that other thing, that pointing to your lap?  What's that supposed to mean exactly?  Does that mean pull over, I want to show you what a big fat slob I am or...

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Does that mean suck my dick?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Hey.  Where'd you learn to shoot like that?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Texas... You were right about what happened to me there.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: You know what's happened, don't you?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: We've gone insane.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Yup.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: I guess we shoulda made some kinda plan for what to do if we get caught.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Yeah, right.  We're not gonna get caught.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: How far are we from Mexico?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: About two hundred and fifty miles.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: How long do you think that'll take?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Shit!

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Did you see that guy?!  He was right in the middle of the road!

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Shit!

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: What?!

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: What?!  What d'you think?!

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: We probably shoulda filled up the car before we blew up that truck.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: They'll probably catch us when we have to stop for gas!

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: I know this whole thing was my fault.  I know it is.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: There's one thing you oughta understand by now, Thelma, it's not your fault.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Louise... no matter what happens, I'm glad I came with you.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: You're crazy.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: You're a good friend.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: You too, sweetie, the best.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: I guess I went a little crazy, huh?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: No... You've always been crazy. This is just the first chance you've had to really express yourself.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: I guess everything from here on in is going to be pretty shitty.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Unbearable, I'd imagine.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: I guess everything we've got to lose is already gone anyway.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: How do you stay so positive?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Louise!

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: What?!

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: What in the hell is that up there?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Where?!

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Way up ahead!

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: What in the hell is it?!

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: It's the Goddamn Grand Canyon!

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Isn't it beautiful?!!

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: It's grand!

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: God!  It looks like the Army!

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: All this for us?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Now what?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: We're not giving up, Thelma.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Then let's not get caught.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: What are you talkin' about?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Go.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Go?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: You're a good friend.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: You, too, sweetie, the best.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: We been seein' you all along the way.

turns.speaker: TRUCKER
turns.text: Yeah.  I been seein' you, too.

turns.speaker: TRUCKER
turns.text: What?  What are you talkin' about?

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: You know good and damn well what I'm talkin' about.

turns.speaker: TRUCKER
turns.text: You women are crazy!

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: You got that right.

turns.speaker: TRUCKER
turns.text: I'm not apologizing for shit!

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Say you're sorry.

turns.speaker: TRUCKER
turns.text: Fuck that.

turns.speaker: LOUISE
turns.text: Are you going to apologize or not?

turns.speaker: TRUCKER
turns.text: Fuck you.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Hi!

turns.speaker: TRUCKER
turns.text: Hi there!  You alright?

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: We're fine!  How are you?

turns.speaker: TRUCKER
turns.text: Grrrreat!

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Where you goin'?

turns.speaker: TRUCKER
turns.text: Fresno.

turns.speaker: TRUCKER
turns.text: Oh, Jesus!

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: You probably even called us beavers on your CB radio, didn't you?

turns.speaker: TRUCKER
turns.text: Yeah... sure did.

turns.speaker: THELMA
turns.text: Damn.  I hate that!  I hate bein' called a beaver, don't you?

turns.speaker: BOSS'S DISABLED BROTHER
turns.text: Hey, shit-for-brains, be careful not to scratch that thing, huh?

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: BOSS'S DISABLED BROTHER
turns.text: You heard me. You already put a fucking nick in my piano.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: I'll try to be more careful.

turns.speaker: BOSS'S DISABLED BROTHER
turns.text: S'matter with you? You look like you're fading.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: The thing's kind of heavy.

turns.speaker: BOSS'S DISABLED BROTHER
turns.text: Heavy? Heavy?! What I wouldn't give to know what heavy feels like, you insensitive prick.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: No, I just meant...

turns.speaker: BOSS'S DISABLED BROTHER
turns.text: Yeah yeah. I'm going to the corner to get a cup of coffee.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Isn't that just my luck -- I get caught for everything.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE CAVALLO
turns.text: So you admit it?

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Guilty as charged. I'm not gonna play games with you. I could give you a song and dance but what's the point? I did it and we all know it.  The hitcher himself told me it's illegal. The irony...

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE CAVALLO
turns.text: Well, uh, can you tell us his name?

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Jeez, I didn't catch it.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE CAVALLO
turns.text: This wasn't your first time, was it, Ted? How many we talking?

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Hitchhikers? I don't know -- fifty... a hundred maybe -- Who keeps track?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE CAVALLO
turns.text: No harm, no foul?

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: I guess.

turns.speaker: DOM
turns.text: Did you get my letter, Mare? The one about Ted?

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: You sent that?

turns.speaker: DOM
turns.text: Uh-huh. I was worried about you.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Well... thank you. But... you know you're not supposed to be within four hundred yards of me.

turns.speaker: DOM
turns.text: That's what I want to tell ya. I've been through two years of extensive psychotherapy and you know what? You were right -- I needed help.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: That's great, Woogie, I'm happy you're better -- you seem... good --but... you put me through quite an ordeal, you know.

turns.speaker: DOM
turns.text: Look at me, Mary. On my mother's soul, on God above, on everything that is holy to me, I did not steal your shoes.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Woogie, I caught you red-handed.

turns.speaker: DOM
turns.text: All right, I did, but I was in a weird place then.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: I'm asking you to leave.

turns.speaker: DOM
turns.text: Oh, Mary, honey, you're taking this all wrong.  I'm not leaving...

turns.speaker: DOM
turns.text: ...Not until I get a little something to remember you by.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Stop that! No! Somebody help me!!!!!

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Stop it!

turns.speaker: DOM
turns.text: Just one pair! You owe me that much, you heartless bitch!

turns.speaker: DOM
turns.text: Gay? He said you were gay?

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: He implied it.

turns.speaker: DOM
turns.text: Well you're a writer, and a lot of writers are gay. Look at Truman Capote.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Yeah, but he was successful.

turns.speaker: DOM
turns.text: Let me ask you this: When you smoke a cigar, do you ever pretend it has balls?

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Come on, that wouldn't make me gay.

turns.speaker: DOM
turns.text: I'm going to fix you up with my new assistant.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: What's he like?
